description: Pro-Palestinian TikTok posts gain traction with Gen Z, while slicker Israeli content is popular on X.
maintext: I spotted this happening with some of Daniel's content. Both in re-posted "stitches", and in comments below Daniel's own posts, people were suggesting his dancing videos were disrespectful to civilians being killed in Gaza. One user commented "shameless" while another said: "The more you show your cruelty in the eyes of the world."
title: Slick videos or more 'authentic' content? The Israel-Gaza battles raging on TikTok and X
